subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: A heater used for air-conditioning or as part of an air-conditioning system must be—

ol.li: a solar heater; or
a gas heater; or
a heat pump heater or 4-pipe chiller; or
a heater using reclaimed heat from another process such as reject heat from a refrigeration plant; or

an electric resistance heater if the heating capacity is:—
with a heating capacity is not more than—
10 W/m2 of the floor area of the conditioned space in climate zone 1; or
40 W/m2 of the floor area of the conditioned space in climate zone 1 or 2; or
the value specified in Table J6D10 in climate zone 3 to 8; orwhere reticulated gas is not available at the allotment boundary; or
where the annual energy consumption for heating is not more than 15 kWh/m2 of the floor area of the conditioned space in climate zones 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5; or
the in-duct heater complies with J6D3(1)(b)(iii)J6D3(1)(c)(iv);or
any combination of (a) to (e).

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: An electric resistance heater may be used for heating a bathroom in if—a Class 2, 3, 9a or 9c building if the heating capacity is not more than 1.2 kW and the heater has a timer.

ol.xt:author: Lee Liu
ol.li: the heating capacity is not more than 1.2 kW; and
the heater has a time switch configured to deactivate the heater after a run-on period not more than 15 minutes from when there are no occupants in the space served.

subclause.title: NSW REPLACE SubClause
subclause.p: An electric heater may be used for heating a bathroom in a Class 3, 9a or 9c building if the heating capacity is not more than 1.2 kW and the heater has a timer.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: A fixed heating or cooling appliance that moderates the temperature of an outdoor space must— be configured to automatically shut down when

ol.xt:author: Lee Liu
ol.li: be a radiant heater or evaporative cooler; and

be configured to automatically shut down when—
there are no occupants in the space served; or
a period of one hour has elapsed since the last activation of the heater; or
the space served has reached the design temperature. for heating; or
the space served has reached the design temperature for 30 minutes for cooling.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: A gas water heater, that is used as part of an air-conditioning system, must— achieve a minimum gross thermal efficiency of 90%.

ol.xt:author: Lee Liu
ol.li: if rated to consume 500 MJ/hour of gas or less, achieve a minimum gross thermal efficiency of 86%; or
if rated to consume more than 500 MJ/hour of gas, achieve a minimum gross thermal efficiency of 90%.

subclause.xt:author: Lee Liu
subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: A building with gas space heating must be provided with—

ol.xt:author: Lee Liu
ol.li:
a reserved electrical capacity sufficient to support future installation of—
electric resistance space heating system with a heating capacity of not more than the value specified in J6D9(1)(e)(i) or (ii); or
air-source heat pump water heating equipment with a coefficient of performance of 3.25; or
a combination of (i) and (ii); and

reserved space within the main electrical distribution board, labelled accordingly, sized to facilitate future installation of switchgear and electrical supply for electric space heating equipment sized in accordance with (a); and
reserved space in the electrical riser or supply pathway to facilitate supply for future electric space heating equipment sized in accordance with (a).

subclause.xt:author: Lee Liu
subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: Where reserved capacity for air-source heat pump water heating equipment is required by (5), the building must be provided with—

ol.xt:author: Lee Liu
ol.li:
reserved space for an open-roofed plant room or rooftop plant area with—
an area of at least 36 m² plus 0.04 m²/kW of heating capacity to facilitate future installation of air-source heat pump water heating equipment; and
sufficient ventilation openings to achieve airflow of at least 100 L/s per kW of heating capacity to facilitate future air-source heat pump equipment, with no recirculation of air; and
connection to the space heating hot water system; and
a hot water circulation system that can deliver the design heating load at a peak temperature of less than 50°C.

subclause.xt:author: Lee Liu
subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: Capacity and space required by (5) and (6) must be sufficient to serve all of the conditioned space with the same design load used to specify the gas space heater equipment.

subclause.xt:author: Lee Liu
subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: Each connected group of one or more air-source heat pump water heaters, including 4-pipe chillers, must—

ol.xt:author: Lee Liu
ol.li: when operating in heating mode have a capacity-weighted average coefficient of performance for heating mode operation of not less than 3.14 at intermediate temperature and standard rating conditions as specified in Table 13 of EN 14511-2; and

when operating in cooling mode—
have a capacity-weighted average energy efficiency ratio at full load of not less than—
2.9 when determined in accordance with AHRI 551/591; or
2.9 when determined at the standard rating conditions specified in Table 16 of EN 14511-2; and
have a capacity-weighted average part load performance assessed based on—
integrated part load value of not less than 4.69 when determined in accordance with AHRI 551/591; or
Seasonal Energy Efficiency Ratio of 3.91 when determined in accordance with methods of Part 5 of EN 14825, at the standard part load conditions defined in Part 4 of EN 14825.

subclause.xt:author: Lee Liu
subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: The capacity-weighted average of each efficiency metric in (8) must be calculated in accordance with the following formula:
